text.p: Computershare Ltd said on Tuesday it has bought Ernst & Young Registry Services Pty Ltd and KPMG Registrars Pty Ltd for A$39.75 million from their parent accounting firms.
The acquisition would be funded from debt and proceeds from the placement of 2.29 million shares with the Bank of Scotland Plc earlier this month, the software developer said.
The two businesses provide registry services to the Australian, New Zealand and U.K. markets.
Computershare said the sale followed concerns by the two accounting firms about rule changes requiring registry services to remain independent.
It did not expect major changes to the operations of either business, and present management and staff would remain.
